sailpoint.object

Class CompositeDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.CompositeDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class CompositeDefinition
extends AbstractXmlObject
    Defines the composition of a composite application and the relationship between the composite and it's tier applications. ThisSailPoint.connector.DefaultCompositeConnector, which is our base, out of the box connector for composites.

    NOTE: CompositeConnector implementations can completely custom to a customer, so it should not be assumed that a composite application will have this definition.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Returns:
        Non-null List of app names.

      • getAccountRule

        public java.lang.String getAccountRule()
        Name of a rule used to generate composite links for a given identity. If this rule is set, any correlation definitions on the tiers will be ignored.

        This should be a rule of type SailPoint.Rule.Type.CompositeAccount.

      • setAccountRule

        public void setAccountRule(java.lang.String accountRule)

      • getRemediationRule

        public java.lang.String getRemediationRule()
        Rule which converts an abstract provisioning plan on a composite into a concrete plan composed of remediations on the tier applications. This should be a rule of type SailPoint.Rule.Type.CompositeRemediation.
